examples:
The programme will take a detailed and provocative look at the problem of homelessness.
這個節目將以啟發性的視角詳細審視無家可歸這個問題。

blocks.def: causing an angry reaction, usually intentionally
blocks.trans: （通常指故意地）使人生氣的，挑釁的，煽動的
examples:
a provocative question/remark
挑釁性的問題／評論
 In a deliberately provocative speech, she criticized the whole system of government.
在一次有意挑釁的演說中，她把整個政府體制批判了一番。

blocks.def: If behaviour or clothing is provocative, it is intended to cause sexual desire.
examples:
She slowly leaned forward in a provocative way.
她挑逗地慢慢向前彎下身。

blocks.def: Vociferous people express their opinions and complaints loudly and repeatedly in speech, and vociferous demands, etc. are made repeatedly and loudly.
blocks.trans: 大聲疾呼的；大聲叫喊的；喧嚷的
examples:
Local activist groups have become increasingly vociferous as the volume of traffic passing through the village has increased.
隨著途經村子的車輛不斷增加，當地激進主義團體的抱怨聲也越來越大。
 A vociferous opponent of gay rights, he is well-known for his right-wing views.
他是同性戀權利的公開反對者，以其右翼觀點而聞名。

blocks.def: to stay away from someone or something
examples:
I try to avoid supermarkets on Saturdays - they're always so busy.
我儘量避開週六去超級市場——那時總是人特別多。
 I'm anxious to avoid the motorway at rush hour.
在交通高峰時段，我對高速公路唯恐避之不及。
 Do you think Lukas is avoiding me? I haven't seen him all day.
你認為盧卡斯是不是在躲著我啊？我一整天都沒見到他。

blocks.def: to prevent something from happening or to not allow yourself to do something
examples:
[ + -ing verb ] I try to avoid going shopping on Saturdays.
我盡量不在週六去購物。
 The report studiously avoided any mention of the controversial plan.
這份報告有意避而不談那個有爭議的計劃。
 The plane narrowly avoided disaster when one of the engines cut out on take-off.
飛機起飛時有一個引擎熄火，差點釀成重大事故。
 I left the pub to avoid a fight (= prevent a fight from happening).
我不想動手打架，就離開了酒吧。
 Unnecessary paperwork should be avoided (= prevented) at all costs.
應該盡可能避免不必要的文書工作。

blocks.def: to lack or be without something that is necessary or usual
examples:
Their apartment is devoid of all comforts.
他們的公寓沒有任何能提供舒適享受的設施。
 He seems to be devoid of compassion.
他似乎缺少同情心。

blocks.def: done, made, or given willingly, without being forced or paid to do it
examples:
She does voluntary work for the Red Cross two days a week.
她每週志願為紅十字會服務兩天。
 They chose to take voluntary redundancy.
他們選擇自願離職。
 voluntary workers
義工

blocks.def: A voluntary organization is controlled and supported by people who give their time and money to it without being paid, and that exists to help other people.
examples:
The hospital has asked various voluntary organizations to help raise money for the new operating theatre.
醫院已經請求各種志願組織為籌建新手術室募集資金。
 the voluntary sector
公益界

blocks.def: likely to change suddenly and unexpectedly or suddenly become violent or angry
blocks.trans: 不穩定的；易變的；易怒的，喜怒無常的
examples:
Food and fuel prices are very volatile in a war situation.
戰爭時期食品和燃料的價格極易波動。
 The situation was made more volatile by the fact that people had been drinking a lot of alcohol.
人們一直在大喝烈酒，這讓情況變得更加不穩定。
 He had a volatile temper and couldn't have been easy to live with.
他的脾氣十分暴躁，別人很難與他相處。

blocks.def: A volatile liquid or solid substance will change easily into a gas.
blocks.trans: （液體或固體）易揮發的，易氣化的

blocks.def: the way in which living things change and develop over millions of years
examples:
Darwin's theory of evolution
達爾文的進化論

blocks.def: a gradual process of change and development
examples:
the evolution of language
語言的發展

blocks.def: very twisted
examples:
a very convoluted route/knot
曲折盤旋的路線／纏繞的繩結

blocks.def: Convoluted sentences, explanations, arguments, etc. are unreasonably long and difficult to understand.
blocks.trans: （句子、解釋、論據等）冗長費解的，繁複晦澀的
examples:
His grammar explanations are terribly convoluted.
他對文法的講解非常晦澀難懂。
 Her book is full of long, convoluted sentences.
她的書裡全是些冗長晦澀的句子。

blocks.def: to (cause power or responsibility to) be given to other people
examples:
To be a good manager, you must know how to devolve responsibility downwards.
要成為一名優秀的經理就必須懂得如何向下放權。
formal Those duties will necessarily devolve on/upon me.
那些任務必然會落到我的頭上。

blocks.def: If a large number of people revolt, they refuse to be controlled or ruled, and take action against authority, often violent action.
examples:
The people revolted against foreign rule and established their own government.
人們奮起反抗外來統治，並成立了自己的政府。

blocks.def: to make someone feel unpleasantly shocked or disgusted
examples:
We were revolted by the dirt and mess in her house.
她家裡又髒又亂，我們看著心裡生厭。
 It revolts me to know that the world spends so much money on arms when millions are dying of hunger.
這個世界有數以百萬計的人因饑餓掙扎在死亡線上，但卻有那麽多的錢花在軍備上，這真讓我感到震驚。

blocks.def: an attempt to get rid of a government by using violence
examples:
Troops were called in to crush/put down the revolt.
軍隊被調來鎮壓叛亂。
 The army is in revolt (against its commanders).
軍隊叛亂（調轉槍口指向了指揮官們）。

blocks.def: speaking a lot, with confidence and enthusiasm
blocks.trans: 健談的；侃侃而談的；能言善辯的
examples:
She was a voluble, smart, funny interviewee.
她是一位健談、聰穎而且幽默的採訪對象。

blocks.def: involving a lot of words spoken confidently and forcefully
examples:
Two people walked by having a voluble argument.
兩個人從旁邊走過，一直不停地激烈爭論。

blocks.def: a large and especially badly organized number of things
examples:
We are reducing the company's welter of development projects and will streamline sales and marketing.
我們正在縮減公司雜亂無章的開發專案，並將精簡銷售和市場行銷部門。

blocks.def: to eat something eagerly and in large amounts so that nothing is left
examples:
The young cubs hungrily devoured the deer.
幼獅們貪婪地吞食著鹿肉。

blocks.def: to destroy something completely
examples:
The flames quickly devoured the building.
火焰很快吞噬了那座建築物。

blocks.def: to read books or literature quickly and eagerly
examples:
She loves to read - she devours one book after another.
她非常喜歡讀書——如饑似渴地讀了一本又一本。

blocks.def: very eager for something, especially a lot of food
blocks.trans: 饑渴的；渴求的；（尤指）貪吃的
examples:
He has a voracious appetite (= he eats a lot).
他的食量驚人。
 He's a voracious reader of historical novels (= he reads a lot of them eagerly and quickly).
他如饑似渴地閱讀歷史小說。

blocks.def: to make a determined decision or promise to do something
examples:
[ + (that) ] The guerrillas vowed (that) they would overthrow the government.
遊擊隊發誓要推翻政府。
 [ + to infinitive ] After the awful meals we had last Christmas, I vowed to do more of the cooking myself.
自從去年聖誕節我們吃過幾頓糟糕的飯之後，我就發誓要自己常做飯。

blocks.def: a serious promise or decision
examples:
[ + to infinitive ] She took/made a vow never to lend money to anyone again.
她發誓再也不借錢給別人了。

blocks.def: to admit something or say something publicly
examples:
[ + that ] He avowed that he regretted what he had done.
他承認對自己的所作所為感到後悔。
 It is a society in which homosexuality is rarely avowed.
這樣一個社會中，很少有人公開承認自己是同性戀。

blocks.def: to say that you know nothing about something, or that you have no responsibility for or connection with something
blocks.trans: 聲稱對…一無所知；否認對…負有任何責任；聲稱與…毫無關聯
examples:
They were quick to disavow the rumour.
他們迅速否認與那些謠傳有任何牽連。
 She tried to disavow her past.
她試圖否認自己的過去。

blocks.def: not suitable, simple, dignified or beautiful; not in the style preferred by the upper classes of society
examples:
a vulgar patterned shirt
圖案粗俗的襯衫
 Isn't it rather vulgar to talk about how much money you earn?
談論賺多少錢難道不庸俗嗎？
humorous I've no idea how much the clothes cost because there was nothing so vulgar as a price tag in evidence.
我不知道那些衣服值多少錢，因為上面連一個普通的價格標籤都看不到。

blocks.def: rude and likely to upset or anger people, especially by referring to sex and the body in an unpleasant way
examples:
It was an extremely vulgar joke.
那是個極為下流的笑話。

blocks.def: to make something secret known
examples:
Journalists do not divulge their sources.
記者們不會透露消息來源。
 [ + question word ] The CEO refused to divulge how much she earned.
執行長拒絕透露她的收入。

blocks.def: to spread beliefs or ideas among a lot of people
to announce something publicly, especially a new law
examples:
The new law was finally promulgated in the autumn of last year.
新法律最終於去年秋天頒布。

blocks.def: to help or encourage someone to do something wrong or illegal
blocks.trans: 教唆，唆使，慫恿；夥同…作案
examples:
His accountant had aided and abetted him in the fraud.
他的會計師與他合謀詐騙。

blocks.def: a state of not happening or being used at present
examples:
Hostilities between the two groups have been in abeyance since last June.
從去年六月份以來，雙方一直處於休戰狀態。
 The project is being held in abeyance until agreement is reached on funding it.
在達成融資協議前，該企劃案被暫時擱置。

blocks.def: used to say that two or more people are next to each other and moving in the same direction
blocks.trans: （朝同一方向）並排而行；並肩而行
examples:
We were running/swimming two abreast.
我們倆並肩跑步／游泳。
 The motorcyclist came abreast of her car and shouted abuse at her.
那個騎機車的人跟上來，與她的車並行著，對她破口大駡。

blocks.def: to make sure you know all the most recent facts about a subject or situation
blocks.trans: 了解…的最新情況；跟上…的最新進展
examples:
I try to keep abreast of any developments.
我努力了解所有新的進展情況。

blocks.def: to make a book, play, or piece of writing shorter by removing details and information that is not important
examples:
The book was abridged for children.
這本書刪節後供兒童閱讀。

blocks.def: Something that is absorbing is very interesting and keeps your attention.
examples:
I read her last novel and found it very absorbing.
我讀了她最新一本小說，覺得非常吸引人。

blocks.def: stupid and unreasonable, or silly in a humorous way
blocks.trans: 荒謬的，荒唐的；愚蠢的；可笑的
examples:
What an absurd thing to say!
這話多荒唐啊！
 Don't be so absurd! Of course I want you to come.
別說傻話了！我當然想讓你來。
 It's an absurd situation - neither of them will talk to the other.
這情形真是讓人哭笑不得——他們誰也不理睬誰。
 Do I look absurd in this hat?
我戴這頂帽子是不是很滑稽？

blocks.def: things that happen that are stupid or unreasonable
examples:
The whole situation borders on the absurd.
整個局面幾乎到了荒誕不經的地步。
 She has a keen sense of the absurd.
她對荒誕事物有敏銳的識別能力。

blocks.def: very bad
examples:
abysmal working conditions
惡劣的工作環境
 The food was abysmal.
食物糟透了。
 The standard of the students' work is abysmal.
學生的作業質量極差。

blocks.def: eager to own and collect things
blocks.trans: （對財物）渴望得到的，迫切求取的；貪婪的
examples:
We live in an acquisitive society that views success primarily in terms of material possessions.
我們生活在一個貪求功利的社會中，判斷一個人成功與否首要是看他擁有多少物質財富。

blocks.def: used to describe a company that buys other companies
examples:
It has been one of the most acquisitive firms in recent times, buying over a dozen businesses in the last 18 months.
該公司是近年來收購行為最為頻繁的公司之一，在過去18個月內收購了十幾家公司。

blocks.def: made or happening only for a particular purpose or need, not planned before it happens
blocks.trans: 特別的，專門的；臨時安排的
examples:
an ad hoc committee/meeting
特別委員會／會議
 We deal with problems on an ad hoc basis (= as they happen).
我們應對問題的方式是只要出現就隨時解決。

blocks.def: impossible to persuade, or unwilling to change an opinion or decision
blocks.trans: 固執的；堅決的，堅定不移的
examples:
[ + that ] I've told her she should stay at home and rest but she's adamant that she's coming.
我告訴過她應該在家裡休息，可她堅持要來。

blocks.def: a young person who is developing into an adult
being or relating to an adolescent
examples:
an adolescent boy
青春期的男孩
 adolescent concerns/traumas/problems
青春期孩子關心的問題／青春期精神創傷／青春期問題

blocks.def: used to describe an adult or an adult's behaviour that is silly and like a child's
blocks.trans: （成年人或其行為）孩子氣的，幼稚的
examples:
adolescent humour/behaviour
孩子氣的幽默／幼稚的舉止

blocks.def: suddenly filled with strong feelings of shock and worry
examples:
He looked at her aghast.
他驚恐地看著她。

blocks.def: speed and eagerness
examples:
She accepted the money with alacrity.
她欣然收下了錢。

blocks.def: although
examples:
The evening was very pleasant, albeit a little quiet.
那個夜晚過得非常愉快，儘管有點兒冷清。
 He tried, albeit without success.
雖然沒有成功，可他努力了。

blocks.def: If you allay a strong emotion felt by someone, such as fear or worry, you cause them to feel it less or to feel calm again.
examples:
The government is trying to allay public fears/concern about the spread of the disease.
政府正努力消除公眾對疾病蔓延的恐懼／擔心。

blocks.def: the quality of being attractive, interesting, or exciting
examples:
the allure of working in television
電視行業工作所具有的吸引力
 sexual allure
性魅力

blocks.def: not friendly or willing to take part in things
examples:
She seemed rather aloof when in fact she was just shy.
她看似孤傲不群，可實際上只是靦腆。

blocks.def: not interested or involved, usually because you do not approve of what is happening
blocks.trans: （通常因為對所發生的事情不贊同而）漠不關心的，無動於衷的，不參與的
examples:
Whatever is happening in the office, she always remains aloof.
不管辦公室發生了甚麼事，她都一概不聞不問。
 She kept herself aloof from her husband's business.
她對丈夫的事情漠不關心。

blocks.def: a mixture of mercury and another metal, especially one used by dentists to repair teeth
blocks.trans: （尤指牙醫用來補牙的）汞合金，汞齊
examples:
an amalgam filling
汞合金補牙填料

blocks.def: a combination of parts that create a complete whole
examples:
The show was a wonderful amalgam of dance, music, and drama.
這場表演出神入化地將舞蹈、音樂和戲劇融為一體。
 Nearly every new parent feels an amalgam of joy and terror.
幾乎每一個初為父母的人都會感到既喜悅又恐懼。

blocks.def: providing support or help
blocks.trans: 輔助的，補充的；附屬的，附加的
examples:
ancillary staff/workers
輔助人員／工人
 an ancillary role
配角
 Campaigning to change government policy is ancillary to the charity's direct relief work.
除了直接採取救援行動外，慈善組織還大力開展活動，以促成政府改變其政策。

blocks.def: a short, often funny story, especially about something someone has done
examples:
He told one or two amusing anecdotes about his years as a policeman.
他講了一兩件他當員警時發生的趣事。

blocks.def: to make someone holy in a religious ceremony by putting holy water or oil on them
blocks.trans: （在宗教儀式上）塗聖水（或聖油）於

blocks.def: to make someone king or queen, especially as part of a religious ceremony
blocks.trans: （尤指作為授予王位的宗教儀式的一部分）塗聖水（或聖油）於
examples:
[ + obj + noun  ] In 751 Pepin was anointed king.
在751年，丕平被塗聖油，立為國王。

blocks.def: to choose someone to do a particular job, usually by a person in authority
examples:
[ + as + noun ] It remains to be seen whom the chairman will anoint as his successor.
董事長將指定何人作為其接班人，還需拭目以待。

blocks.def: a chemical, especially a drug, that limits the effects of a poison
examples:
Sales of nerve gas antidotes increased dramatically before the war.
在戰爭爆發前，神經毒氣解毒劑銷量激增。

blocks.def: a way of preventing or acting against something bad
blocks.trans: 矯正方法；緩解辦法；對抗手段
examples:
Regular exercise is the best antidote to tiredness and depression.
經常鍛煉是消除疲勞和憂鬱的最好方法。

blocks.def: confidence and style
examples:
Rosalind conducted the meeting with characteristic aplomb/with her usual aplomb.
羅莎琳德以她特有／一貫的泰然自若的風度主持了會議。

blocks.def: mysterious and known only by a few people
blocks.trans: 神秘的；秘密的；晦澀難懂的
examples:
He was the only person who understood all the arcane details of the agreement.
他是唯一能看懂協議中所有那些晦澀難懂的繁縟條文的人。
 This argument may seem arcane to those not closely involved in the world of finance.
對於那些不諳金融界事務的人而言，這種觀點如同天書。

blocks.def: of or belonging to an ancient period in history
examples:
an archaic system of government
古老的政體
 an archaic law/rule/language
古代法律／法規／語言

blocks.def: difficult, needing a lot of effort and energy
examples:
an arduous climb/task/journey
舉步維艱的攀登／艱巨的任務／艱難的旅程

blocks.def: clever and skilful, especially in getting what you want
blocks.trans: （尤指在獲得自己想要的東西方面）巧妙的，機靈的，取巧的
examples:
He has shown himself to be an artful politician.
可以看出他是個八面玲瓏的政客。
 The prime minister dealt with the interviewer's questions in a very artful way.
首相很巧妙地回答了採訪者的問題。

blocks.def: avoiding physical pleasures and living a simple life, often for religious reasons
blocks.trans: （常指因宗教原因）苦行的，禁慾的，過清苦生活的
examples:
They live a very ascetic life.
他們過著清心寡慾的生活。

blocks.def: someone who lives an ascetic life, often for religious reasons
examples:
He lived as an ascetic.
他過著苦行者的日子。

blocks.def: to make unpleasant feelings less strong
examples:
The government has tried to assuage the public's fears.
政府努力消除公眾的恐慌。

blocks.def: able to understand a situation quickly and see how to take advantage of it
examples:
an astute investor/businesswoman
精明的投資者／女商人
 his astute handling of the situation
他對局勢的巧妙處理
 an astute observer of human behaviour
人類行為的敏銳觀察者

blocks.def: an extremely cruel, violent, or shocking act
blocks.trans: 兇惡的行為，殘暴的行為
examples:
They are on trial for committing atrocities against the civilian population.
他們因殘害平民的暴行而受到審判。

blocks.def: the fact of something being extremely cruel, violent, or shocking
examples:
These people are guilty of acts of appalling atrocity (= cruelty).
這些人犯下了令人髮指的殘忍罪行。

blocks.def: (of a part of the body) to be reduced in size and therefore strength, or, more generally, to become weaker
examples:
After several months in a hospital bed, my leg muscles had atrophied.
我在醫院病床上留了幾個月後，腿部肌肉已經萎縮了。
 In the 1980s, their political power gradually atrophied (= became weaker).
他們的政治權力在20世紀80年代逐漸衰落。

blocks.def: to be a sign of especially good or bad things in the future
examples:
The company's sales figures for the first six months augur well for the rest of the year.
公司前六個月的銷售額預示著下半年形勢看好。
 Do you think that this recent ministerial announcement augurs (= is a sign of) a shift in government policy?
你是否認為最近內閣發布的公告預示著政府政策要發生變化？

blocks.def: very simple and without comfort or unnecessary things, especially because of severe limits on money or goods
examples:
an austere childhood during the war
戰火中艱苦的童年生活

blocks.def: plain and without decoration
examples:
The courtroom was a large, dark chamber, an austere place.
法庭是一個大而陰暗的房間，樸實無華。

blocks.def: very severe and unfriendly in manner
examples:
He was a tall, austere, forbidding figure.
他身材高大，神色嚴肅，令人生畏。

blocks.def: the painters, writers, musicians, and other artists whose ideas, styles, and methods are very original or modern in comparison to the period in which they live, or the work of these artists
blocks.trans: 先鋒派（畫家、作家、音樂家等）；先鋒派作品
examples:
New York is the international capital of the musical avant-garde.
紐約是世界先鋒派音樂之都。

blocks.def: Avant-garde ideas, styles, and methods are very original or modern in comparison to the period in which they happen.
examples:
avant-garde art/cinema/painting
先鋒派藝術／電影／畫作
 It was one of the first avant-garde works to appeal to a wide audience.
這是受到觀眾廣泛好評的首批先鋒派作品之一。

blocks.def: an extremely strong wish to get or keep money or possessions
examples:
Her business empire brought her wealth beyond the dreams of avarice (= an extremely large amount of money).
她的商業帝國帶給她的財富之巨是做夢都不敢想像的。

blocks.def: not in the intended way
blocks.trans: 離開預期方向（的）；出錯（的）
examples:
Anything that goes awry (= goes wrong) in the office is blamed on Pete.
辦公室甚麼事情出了錯，都會怪罪到彼特頭上。
 The strike has sent the plans for investment seriously awry.
罷工嚴重打亂了投資計劃。

blocks.def: in the wrong position
examples:
She rushed in, her face red and sweaty and her hat awry.
她衝了進來，滿臉通紅、一頭大汗，帽子都歪了。

blocks.def: obviously true and therefore not needing to be proved
blocks.trans: 成為公理的；不需證明的，不言自明的
examples:
It is an axiomatic fact that governments rise and fall on the state of the economy.
經濟狀況決定政府的興衰成敗，這是不言自明的事實。
 It seems axiomatic that everyone would benefit from a better scientific education.
更好的科學教育會使每個人受益，這似乎是不言自明的。

blocks.def: to say unpleasant and unkind things about someone who is not there
blocks.trans: 背後誹謗，背後中傷，背後說壞話
examples:
I'm not short-tempered, but I do get annoyed if friends backbite me.
我並不是愛發脾氣，可要是有朋友在背後說我壞話，我也是會生氣的。

blocks.def: an animal with greyish-brown fur, a black and white head and a pointed face, that lives underground and comes out to feed at night
to persuade someone by telling them repeatedly to do something, or to question someone repeatedly
examples:
Stop badgering me - I'll do it when I'm ready.
別再煩我了——我準備好了就會做的。
 [ + into + -ing verb ] She's been badgering me into doing some exercise.
她一直勸我做做運動。
 [ + to infinitive ] Every time we go into a shop, the kids badger me to buy them sweets.
每次走進商店裡，孩子們總是苦苦要求我，給他們買些糖果。

blocks.def: to cause someone to be completely unable to understand or explain something
examples:
She was completely baffled by his strange behaviour.
她完全被他怪異的舉動弄迷糊了。

blocks.def: boring, ordinary, and not original
examples:
He just sat there making banal remarks all evening.
他整晚只是坐在那裡，說些老套的話。
 banal pop songs
平淡無奇的流行歌曲

blocks.def: conversation that is funny and not serious
examples:
He considered himself a master of witty banter.
他認為自己是風趣幽默的玩笑大王。

blocks.def: to talk to someone in a friendly and humorous way
examples:
He stood around bantering with his colleagues.
他轉來轉去，與同事們打趣逗樂。

blocks.def: relating to the heavily decorated style in buildings, art, and music that was popular in Europe in the 17th century and the early part of the 18th century
examples:
baroque architecture/painters
巴羅克風格的建築／畫家

blocks.def: unable to produce plants or fruit
examples:
We drove through a barren, rocky landscape.
我們駕車經過一個到處都是岩石的不毛之地。

blocks.def: unable to have children or young animals
not creating or producing anything new
examples:
She became very depressed during the barren years when she was unable to paint.
在無法作畫、作品匱乏的那幾年裡，她變得非常消沉。

blocks.def: often feeling uncomfortable with other people and easily embarrassed
examples:
She gave a bashful smile as he complimented her on her work.
當他恭維她的工作成果時，她靦腆地笑了笑。

blocks.def: a part of a machine that supports another part that turns around
examples:
a wheel bearing
車輪軸承
 a roller bearing
滾柱軸承

blocks.def: to discover your exact position
examples:
The road system was so complicated that we had to stop to get our bearings several times.
路線非常複雜，好幾次使我們不得不停下來確定方位。

blocks.def: to succeed in becoming familiar with a new situation
examples:
It takes a while to get your bearings when you start a new job.
剛開始做一份工作時，需要花上一段時間才能適應新環境。

blocks.def: If you lose your bearings, you do not know where you are.
examples:
They lost their bearings in the dark.
他們在黑暗中迷路了。

blocks.def: an exact position, measured clockwise (= to the right) from north. Bearings are given as three numbers
examples:
The campsite is 5 miles away from here on a bearing of 045 degrees.
野營地離這裡有5英里，方位角為45度。
 The yachtsman took a bearing on (= found his position by using) the lighthouse.
遊艇駕駛者根據燈塔確定方位。

blocks.def: to have an influence on something or a relationship to something
examples:
What you decide now could have a considerable bearing on your future.
你現在所作的決定可能會對你的將來產生極大影響。

blocks.def: someone's way of moving and behaving
examples:
She had a proud, distinguished bearing.
她舉止高貴。

blocks.def: supporting or holding the stated thing
examples:
a load-bearing wall
承重牆
 ore-bearing rocks
礦物質構成的岩石

blocks.def: to confuse someone
examples:
Federer has a wide repertoire of clever shots that befuddle even the best of his opponents.
費德勒擊球技巧高超多樣，即使最強的對手也會被他迷惑。

blocks.def: given or done unwillingly
examples:
The concert attracted begrudging praise from the band's usually hostile critics.
這場音樂會讓一向對該樂團不甚友好的評論人都不得不讚賞有加。

blocks.def: to show something to be false, or to hide something such as an emotion
blocks.trans: 給人以假像；掩飾（感情等）
examples:
Her calm face belied the terror she was feeling.
她平靜的表情掩蓋了內心的恐懼。

blocks.def: to criticize or speak in an angry manner to someone
examples:
As he left the meeting, he was berated by angry demonstrators.
他離開會場時遭到了憤怒的示威者責罵。
 Doctors are often berated for being poor communicators, particularly when they have to give patients bad news.
醫生常常因不善於溝通而遭受指責，特別是當他們必須告訴病人壞消息的時候。

blocks.def: not having something or feeling great loss
examples:
Alone now and almost penniless, he was bereft of hope.
他現在孤身一人，又幾乎身無分文，對生活已不抱一絲希望。
 After the last of their children had left home the couple felt utterly bereft.
最後一個孩子離家之後，這對夫婦感到一無所有了。

blocks.def: to suggest or show
examples:
His letter bespeaks his willingness to help.
他來信表示願意幫忙。

blocks.def: not having a strong taste or character or not showing any interest or energy
blocks.trans: 無滋味的；枯燥乏味的；沒精打采的，無生氣的
examples:
I find chicken a little bland.
我覺得雞肉有點淡。
 Pop music these days is so bland.
現今的流行音樂十分乏味。

blocks.def: very obvious and intentional, when this is a bad thing
examples:
a blatant lie
彌天大謊
 The whole episode was a blatant attempt to gain publicity.
整個事件完全是旨在宣傳的露骨炒作。

blocks.def: a disease that damages and kills plants
something that spoils or has a very bad effect on something, often for a long time
examples:
His arrival cast a blight on the wedding day.
他的到來破壞了大喜之日的氣氛。

blocks.def: to spoil something
examples:
A broken leg blighted her chances of winning the championship.
腿骨折使她失去了獲得冠軍的機會。

blocks.def: a serious mistake, usually caused by not taking care or thinking
blocks.trans: （通常由於粗心或欠考慮而釀成的）大錯
examples:
He said that the tax was a major political blunder.
他稱這項稅收政策是一大政治錯誤。
 I made a blunder by getting his name wrong.
我一疏忽，弄錯了他的名字。

blocks.def: to move in an awkward way
blocks.trans: 跌跌撞撞地走，踉踉蹌蹌地走
examples:
I could hear him blundering around in the darkness.
我能聽見他在黑暗中踉踉蹌蹌地四處亂撞。

blocks.def: to make a serious mistake, usually because of not taking care or thinking
examples:
Police blundered by not releasing more details about the case to focus public interest.
警方因沒有提供更多的詳細案情以引起公眾關注而釀成了大錯。

blocks.def: false, not real, or not legal
blocks.trans: 假的；假冒的，僞造的；非法的
examples:
On investigation, his claim was found to be bogus.
調查發現，他的説法並不屬實。
 She produced some bogus documents to support her application.
她製作了一些偽造的文件來支持她的申請。

blocks.def: to support or improve something or make it stronger
examples:
More money is needed to bolster the industry.
需要更多的錢來扶持該行業。
 She tried to bolster my confidence/morale (= encourage me and make me feel stronger) by telling me that I had a special talent.
她説我有特別的才能，想要增強我的信心。
 They need to do something to bolster their image.
他們需要設法改善他們的形象。

blocks.def: a long firm cylinder-shaped pillow
rude and not considering other people's feelings
blocks.trans: 粗野的，粗魯的，不體諒別人感受的
examples:
I found him rather boorish and aggressive.
我發現他相當粗魯，咄咄逼人。
 The boorish behaviour of some tourists is embarrassing.
一些遊客的粗魯行爲令人尴尬。

blocks.def: belonging to or typical of the middle class (= a social group between the rich and the poor) especially in supporting existing customs and values, or in having a strong interest in money and possessions
blocks.trans: 中産階級的；追求物質享受的；平庸粗俗的
examples:
It's a bit bourgeois, isn't it, joining a golf club?
參加高爾夫球俱樂部有點庸俗，不是嗎？

blocks.def: someone who proudly talks a lot about himself or herself and his or her achievements or possessions
to wave something in the air in a threatening or excited way
examples:
She brandished a saucepan at me so I ran out of the kitchen.
她拿著平底鍋向我揮來，於是我就跑出了廚房。

blocks.def: a show of courage, especially when unnecessary and dangerous, to make people admire you
examples:
It was an act of bravado that made him ask his boss to resign.
就是蠻幹逞能的心理促使他要求老闆辭職的。

blocks.def: obvious, without any attempt to be hidden
blocks.trans: 毫不隱瞞的，明目張膽的
examples:
brazen cheating
明目張膽的作弊行為
 He told me a brazen lie.
他恬不知廉恥地向我撒謊。

blocks.def: a short, stiff hair, usually one of many
examples:
The old woman had a few grey bristles sprouting from her chin.
老婦人下巴上長出幾根灰白的又短又硬的毛。

blocks.def: The bristles of a brush are the stiff hairs or pieces of plastic that are connected to it.
examples:
The best quality men's shaving brushes are made from badger bristle.
最好的男士修面刷由獾毛製成。
 My toothbrush has blue and white plastic bristles.
我的牙刷上有藍白塑膠刷毛。

blocks.def: (of hair) to stand up
examples:
The cat's fur bristled and it arched its back.
那隻貓竪起了毛，弓起了背。

blocks.def: to react angrily
examples:
She bristled at the suggestion that she had in any way neglected the child.
人們認為她多少有點忽略了這孩子，這種看法使她很生氣。

blocks.def: a small stream
examples:
I could hear the sound of a babbling brook.
我可以聽見小溪潺潺的流水聲。

blocks.def: to not allow or accept something, especially a difference of opinion or intention
blocks.trans: 不容忍；不接納（尤指異議）
examples:
She won't brook any criticism of her work.
她不能容忍任何對她工作的批評。

blocks.def: relating to the countryside
examples:
The painting shows a typically bucolic scene with peasants.
這幅畫展現了典型的田園風光，描繪了農夫們的形象。

blocks.def: able to float
examples:
Cork is light and buoyant.
軟木質輕，可浮在水上。

blocks.def: happy and confident
blocks.trans: 歡欣鼓舞的；輕鬆愉快的
examples:
After reading the letter he was in a buoyant mood.
讀了信後，他高興得快要飄起來了。

blocks.def: successful or making a profit
examples:
The housing market remains buoyant.
房屋市場依然是有賺頭的。

blocks.def: developing quickly
examples:
The company hoped to profit from the burgeoning communications industry.
公司希望能從迅速發展的通訊業中獲利。

blocks.def: a structure made of stone or brick that sticks out from and supports a wall of a building
to build buttresses to support a building or structure
examples:
It was decided to buttress the crumbling walls.
人們決定建造扶壁以支撐將要倒塌的牆。

blocks.def: to make support for an idea or argument stronger by providing a good reason for it
examples:
The arguments for change are buttressed by events elsewhere.
其他一些地方的事件肯定了關於變革的想法。

blocks.def: to avoid something by going around it
examples:
We took the road that bypasses the town.
我們選擇了繞過城鎮的道路。
 The oil pipeline bypasses the protected wilderness area.
石油管道繞過了受保護的野生地區。

blocks.def: to ignore a rule or official authority
examples:
They bypassed the committee and went straight to senior management.
他們越過委員會，直接找高級管理層。

blocks.def: a medical operation in which the flow of a person's blood is changed to avoid a diseased part of their heart
blocks.trans: （給心贜接旁通管的）繞道手術，分流術
examples:
a triple bypass operation
冠狀動脈三重繞道手術

blocks.def: a road built around a town or village so that traffic does not need to travel through it
a hidden store of things, or the place where they are kept
examples:
an arms cache
武器隱藏地
 a cache of explosives/weapons/drugs
一批隱藏的炸藥／武器／毒品

blocks.def: an area or type of computer memory in which information that is often in use can be stored temporarily and got to especially quickly
blocks.trans: （電腦的）高速緩衝記憶體；快取記憶體
examples:
256 Kb secondary cache
256千位元組二級快取記憶體

blocks.def: unwilling to give information
blocks.trans: 守口如瓶的，諱莫如深的
examples:
He was very cagey about what happened at the meeting.
他對會上發生的事情閉口不談。

blocks.def: to persuade someone to do something they might not want to do, by pleasant talk and (sometimes false) promises
examples:
He really knows how to cajole people into doing what he wants.
他精於哄騙人們為他做事。
 I managed to cajole her out of leaving too early.
我設法說服了她不要過早離開。
 The most effective technique is to cajole rather than to threaten.
最有效的方法是勸誘而不是威脅。

blocks.def: a serious accident or bad event causing damage or suffering
examples:
A series of calamities ruined them - floods, a failed harvest, and the death of a son.
一連串的災難擊垮了他們——洪水、歉收、喪子。

blocks.def: false and damaging to someone's reputation
blocks.trans: 譭謗的；惡意中傷的；污蔑的
examples:
Most of the article is just a calumnious personal attack.
這篇文章大部分只是誹謗性的人身攻擊。

blocks.def: preserved and sold in a metal container
examples:
canned fruit/tomatoes
罐裝水果／番茄

blocks.def: changing mood or behaviour suddenly and unexpectedly
examples:
a capricious child
任性的小孩
 He was a cruel and capricious tyrant.
他是個殘忍而又反覆無常的暴君。

blocks.def: (the art of making) a drawing or written or spoken description of someone that usually makes them look silly by making part of their appearance or character more noticeable than it really is
blocks.trans: 漫畫（藝術）；諷刺畫；諷刺描述
examples:
The characters in his early novels are a lot subtler than the overblown caricatures in his more recent work.
和他近期作品中誇張的諷刺描述相比，他早期小說中的人物要含蓄得多。
figurative Over the years he's become a grotesque caricature of himself.
經過這麼些年，他已經變得性情乖張，舉止荒謬。

blocks.def: to create a caricature
examples:
Charles Dickens caricatured lawyers (= represented them in a way that made them look silly) in several of his novels.
查爾斯‧狄更斯在幾本小說裡對律師進行了諷刺性描述。

blocks.def: a person who creates caricatures
blocks.trans: 漫畫家，諷刺畫家；諷刺作家

blocks.def: without any doubt or possibility of being changed
examples:
a categorical statement/reply/assurance
明確的聲明／回覆／保證

blocks.def: (of a person or animal) to make a high unpleasant noise like a cat
blocks.trans: （人或動物）發出貓一樣的叫聲

blocks.def: relating to the brain or the cerebrum
demanding or involving careful thinking and mental effort rather than feelings
examples:
She makes cerebral films that deal with important social issues.
她拍攝的影片觸動理智，討論諸多重要的社會問題。

blocks.def: disappointment or anger, especially when caused by a failure or mistake
blocks.trans: （尤指失敗或錯誤引起的）失望，懊喪，懊惱
examples:
My children have never shown an interest in music, much to my chagrin.
我的孩子們從沒對音樂表現出一點興趣，真讓我失望。

blocks.def: someone or something, especially a person or animal, that has beaten all other competitors in a competition
examples:
an Olympic champion
奧運會冠軍
 She is the world champion for the third year in succession.
她第三次蟬聯世界冠軍。
 The defending champion will play his first match of the tournament tomorrow.
衛冕冠軍將在明天參加錦標賽的第一場比賽。
 Who are the reigning European football champions?
誰是目前的歐洲足球冠軍？

blocks.def: a person who enthusiastically supports, defends, or fights for a person, belief, right, or principle
blocks.trans: 擁護者；衛士，捍衛者；鬥士
examples:
She has long been a champion of prisoners' rights/the disabled/free speech.
長期以來，她一直是囚犯權益／殘疾人士利益／言論自由的捍衛者。

blocks.def: to support, defend, or fight for a person, belief, right, or principle enthusiastically
examples:
He has championed constitutional reform for many years.
他支持憲法改革好多年了。

blocks.def: excellent
blocks.trans: 優秀的，第一流的，很好的

blocks.def: stylish and fashionable
examples:
I like your haircut - it's very chic.
我喜歡你的髮型——很時髦。
 a chic restaurant
高雅的餐廳

blocks.def: a hope or dream that is extremely unlikely ever to come true
examples:
Is the ideal of banishing hunger throughout the world just a chimera?
在全世界消除飢餓的理想是否只是癡心妄想？

blocks.def: an organism that contains cells or tissues from two or more different species
examples:
an animal-human chimera
動物與人的嵌合體

blocks.def: rude, unfriendly, and unpleasant
blocks.trans: 粗魯無禮的，粗野的；不友好的；令人討厭的
examples:
They invited me to dinner and I thought it would be churlish to refuse.
他們邀請我去吃晚飯，我覺得拒絕有點不禮貌。

blocks.def: clear or obvious without needing any proof
blocks.trans: 清楚的；明白無誤的；顯而易見的
examples:
She has clear-cut evidence that the company cheated her.
她有確鑿的證據證明公司欺騙了她。

blocks.def: behaving like a clique, not making other people feel welcome
examples:
I decided not to join the tennis club because I found it very cliquey.
我決定不加入那家網球俱樂部，因為我發現那裡非常排外。

blocks.def: to cook food, especially eggs, in water just below boiling temperature
blocks.trans: （尤指把雞蛋在稍低於沸點的水中）煮嫩，煮軟
examples:
coddled eggs
煨煮的雞蛋

blocks.def: to protect someone or something too much
examples:
The steel industry is coddled by trade protection and massive subsidies.
鋼鐵產業受到貿易保護和巨額補貼的雙重呵護。

blocks.def: to persuade someone forcefully to do something that they are unwilling to do
examples:
The court heard that the six defendants had been coerced into making a confession.
法庭在審理中發現六名被告曾受到迫供。

blocks.def: A cogent argument, reason, etc. is clearly expressed and persuades people to believe it.
blocks.trans: （論據或理由）令人信服的，有說服力的，強而有力的

blocks.def: extremely large
examples:
In the centre of the hall stood a colossal wooden statue, decorated in ivory and gold.
大廳中央矗立著一尊用象牙和黃金裝飾的木質巨型雕像。
 They were asking a colossal amount of money for the house.
他們對這房子漫天要價。

blocks.def: the friendship and respect between countries shown by accepting each other's laws, political systems, and customs
blocks.trans: 國際禮讓（國家間的友誼和尊重，表現為接受彼此的法律、政治體系以及風俗習慣）

blocks.def: happening often or often seen or experienced and so not considered to be special
blocks.trans: 平常的；常見的；普通的；普遍的
examples:
Electric cars are increasingly commonplace.
電動汽車越來越普及了。

blocks.def: a boring remark that is used very often and does not have much meaning
blocks.trans: 陳腔濫調；寒暄客套；老生常談
examples:
We exchanged commonplaces about the weather over cups of tea.
我們喝了幾杯茶，就天氣方面的話題寒暄了幾句。

blocks.def: an agreement in an argument in which the people involved reduce their demands or change their opinion in order to agree
examples:
It is hoped that a compromise will be reached in today's talks.
希望今天的會談能達成妥協。
 In a compromise between management and unions, a four percent pay rise was agreed in return for an increase in productivity.
資方與工會達成和解，同意以加薪4%來作為提高生產力的回報。
 The government has said that there will be no compromise with terrorists.
政府聲稱不會對恐怖分子讓步。

blocks.def: to accept that you will reduce your demands or change your opinion in order to reach an agreement with someone
examples:
Party unity is threatened when members will not compromise.
成員不願妥協，黨內團結受到了威脅。
 Well, you want $400 and I say $300, so let's compromise at/on $350.
好吧，你要價400美元，我說300美元，那我們就來個折衷價350美元。

blocks.def: to allow your principles to be less strong or your standards or morals to be lower
examples:
Don't compromise your beliefs/principles for the sake of being accepted.
不要為了得到別人的認同而放棄了你自己的信仰／原則。
 If we back down on this issue, our reputation will be compromised.
如果我們在這個問題上打退堂鼓的話，會有損我們的聲譽。
 His political career ended when he compromised himself by accepting bribes.
他的政治生涯因他收受賄賂而宣告結束。

blocks.def: to risk having a harmful effect on something
examples:
We would never compromise the safety of our passengers.
我們永遠不會做有損乘客安全的事。

blocks.def: possible to imagine or to believe
blocks.trans: 可想像的；可想到的；可以相信的
examples:
Books on every conceivable subject lined one wall.
靠牆一排排地擺放著所有能想得到的各門學科的書。
 It's just conceivable (= possible although difficult to imagine) (that) the hospital made a mistake.
有可能是醫院出了錯。

blocks.def: A conniving person deceives others for their own advantage.
examples:
He's a conniving bastard!
他是個狡詐的混蛋！

blocks.def: a strong feeling of disliking and having no respect for someone or something
examples:
At school she had complete contempt for all her teachers.
在學校讀書時她對所有老師都不屑一顧。
 You should treat those remarks with the contempt that they deserve.
你理應對那些話不屑一顧。
 She's beneath contempt (= I have no respect for her)!
她為人所不齒！

blocks.def: to feel contempt for someone or something
behaviour that is illegal because it does not obey or respect the rules of a law court
examples:
The tobacco companies may be guilty of contempt of court for refusing to produce the documents.
煙草公司可能會因為拒不出示文件而被判藐視法庭罪。

blocks.def: a competition to do better than other people, usually in which prizes are given
examples:
a dance/sports contest
舞蹈／體育比賽
 She's won a lot of beauty contests.
她多次在選美大賽中獲勝。

blocks.def: an attempt, usually against difficulties, to win an election or to get power or control
blocks.trans: （為贏得選舉或權力而進行的）爭取，爭奪
examples:
The contest for the leadership of the party was very bitter.
該党領袖職務的競選爭奪非常激烈。
 The primary in Iowa is the first contest for the Republican nomination.
愛荷華州的初選是爭奪共和黨提名候選人的第一站。

blocks.def: If you contest a formal statement, a claim, a judge's decision, or a legal case, you say formally that it is wrong or unfair and try to have it changed.
examples:
We will certainly contest any claims made against the safety of our products.
我們肯定會駁斥任何批評我們産品安全性的說法。

blocks.def: to compete for something
examples:
The medal is being keenly contested by eight gymnasts.
八名體操運動員在激烈爭奪這枚獎牌。

blocks.def: to attempt to win an election or to get power or control
blocks.trans: 爭取，爭奪（選舉勝利或權力）
examples:
She could win, since only two people are contesting the seat and the other candidate is very unpopular.
她大有希望獲勝，因為只有兩個人爭奪這個位置，而另一個候選人很不得人心。

blocks.def: to arrange a situation or event, or arrange for something to happen, using clever planning
examples:
Couldn't you contrive a meeting between them? I think they'd really like each other.
你不能為他們安排一次會面嗎？我覺得他們真的互有好感。
 [ + to infinitive ] Somehow she contrived to get tickets for the concert.
她不知透過甚麽方式得到了音樂會的門票。

blocks.def: to invent and/or make a device or other object in a clever and possibly unusual way
examples:
Do you think you could contrive something for hanging my clothes on until I can get a wardrobe?
你能設計個東西讓我在買到衣櫃前掛衣服嗎？

blocks.def: to give a lot of attention to making someone comfortable and to protecting them from anything unpleasant
examples:
Children sometimes need to be cosseted.
孩子是需要疼愛的。
disapproving The country has been cosseted (= too protected) by the government for so long that people have forgotten how to take responsibility for themselves.
長久以來，這個國家一直受到政府的過度保護，人們已經忘了自己該如何承擔責任。

blocks.def: easily annoyed and complaining
blocks.trans: 壞脾氣的；易生氣的；好抱怨的
examples:
You're very crabby today. What's bothering you?
你今天心情不好。甚麼事惹惱你了？

blocks.def: extremely cowardly (= not brave)
examples:
a craven act of terrorism
恐怖主義的懦弱行徑

blocks.def: to take a slight and not very serious interest in a subject, or try a particular activity for a short period
examples:
He first dabbled in politics when he was at law school.
他在法學院上學時首次接觸政治。
 She dabbled with drugs at university.
她在大學裡沾上了毒品。

blocks.def: to put part of your body, such as your hand or foot, into the water of a pool or stream, etc. and move it around
making you feel slightly frightened or worried about your ability to achieve something
blocks.trans: 令人發怵的；使人氣餒的
examples:
The country was faced with the daunting prospect of overcoming four decades of division.
國家仍然面臨著彌合40年的分裂這一難題。

blocks.def: an amount or supply that is not large enough
examples:
a dearth of new homes in the region
該地區新住宅的短缺

blocks.def: a complete failure, especially because of bad planning and organization
blocks.trans: （尤指因計劃和組織不周而導致的）徹底失敗，一敗塗地，崩潰
examples:
The collapse of the company was described as the greatest financial debacle in US history.
那間公司的破產被稱為美國歷史上最大的一場金融災難。

blocks.def: to make someone or something physically weak
examples:
Chemotherapy exhausted and debilitated him.
化療使他感到非常疲憊虛弱。

blocks.def: to show that something is less important, less good, or less true than it has been made to appear
examples:
The writer's aim was to debunk the myth that had grown up around the actress.
作者的目的是為了揭穿圍繞這位女演員的種種傳聞。

blocks.def: to kill a large number of something, or to reduce something severely
blocks.trans: 毀滅，大量殺戮；大幅削減
examples:
Populations of endangered animals have been decimated.
瀕臨動物的數量已經大幅減少。

blocks.def: to criticize something as bad, without value, or unnecessary
examples:
Lawyers decried the imprisonment of several journalists.
律師們對幾名記者遭到監禁表示譴責。

blocks.def: to refuse to obey a person, decision, law, situation, etc.
examples:
It is rare to see children openly defying their teachers.
很少看見孩子公然跟老師作對。
 A few workers have defied the majority decision and gone into work despite the strike.
幾個工人不顧大多數人的罷工決定自己去上班了。
 The fact that aircraft don't fall out of the sky always seems to me to defy (= act against) the law of gravity.
我總認為飛機沒有從天上掉下來，是不符合萬有引力定律的。
 A forest fire raging in southern California is defying (= is not changed by) all attempts to control it.
儘管採取了各種措施，加利福尼亞南部的一場森林大火依然在肆虐。

blocks.def: to be extreme or very strange and therefore impossible to believe, describe, or explain
blocks.trans: （因過於極端或奇特而）讓人無法相信／描述／解釋
examples:
The chaos at the airport defies description.
機場一片混亂，難以用語言形容。

blocks.def: to tell someone to do something that you think will be impossible
examples:
I defy you to prove your accusations.
我倒要看看你能不能拿出證據來證實你的指控。
 I defy you to tell where I've painted over the scratch on my car.
你倒是給我指出來車的哪個地方因為有劃痕而補過漆。

blocks.def: to mark or describe the limits of something
examples:
Police powers are delimited by law.
警察的權限是由法律來劃定的。

blocks.def: having parts that are close together so that it is difficult to go or see through
examples:
dense fog
濃霧
 a dense forest
密林
 The body was found hidden in dense undergrowth.
屍體被發時藏在密密的樹叢下面。

blocks.def: stupid
examples:
There are some really dense people in our class.
我們班有些人特別笨。

blocks.def: (of a substance) containing a lot of matter in a small space
examples:
Plutonium is very dense.
鈈的密度很大。

blocks.def: Derelict buildings or places are not cared for and are in bad condition.
examples:
a derelict site
廢棄的工地
 The theatre has been left to stand/lie derelict.
該劇院一直處於廢棄狀態。

blocks.def: a person who has no home or money and often lives outside
to see or notice something or someone
examples:
Miss Bates, passing near the window, descried Mr Knightley on horseback not far off.
貝茨小姐從視窗走過，看見奈特利先生騎著馬就在不遠處。

blocks.def: to hate someone or something very much
examples:
I detest any kind of cruelty.
我厭惡任何形式的殘暴。
 [ + -ing verb ] I detest having to get up when it's dark outside.
我討厭天還未亮就要起床。
 her detested older brother
她那令人討厭的哥哥

blocks.def: very serious or extreme
examples:
These people are in dire need of help.
這些人急需援助。
 He gave a dire warning that an earthquake was imminent.
他鄭重警告說馬上就要地震了。
 This decision will have dire consequences for local people.
這一決定將對當地人產生嚴重的後果。

blocks.def: very bad
examples:
I thought her latest book was dire!
我覺得她最近出版的書糟透了！

blocks.def: having no personal involvement or receiving no personal advantage, and therefore free to act fairly
examples:
a disinterested observer/judgment
公正的觀察員／判斷
 a piece of disinterested advice
一條客觀的建議

blocks.def: too large or too small in comparison to something else, or not deserving its importance or influence
blocks.trans: 不成比例的；不相稱的；太大（或太小）的
examples:
There are a disproportionate number of girls in the class.
這個班裡女孩的人數特別多。
 The country's great influence in the world is disproportionate to its relatively small size.
該國在世界上的巨大影響力與其相對較小的面積有些不成比例。

blocks.def: to make a liquid stronger or purer by heating it until it changes to a gas and then cooling it so that it changes back into a liquid
examples:
Some strong alcoholic drinks such as whisky are made by distilling.
威士卡等烈酒是用蒸餾法製成的。

blocks.def: to get or show only the most important part of something
examples:
Over 80 hours of footage have been distilled into these 40 minutes.
80多個小時的片子被提煉壓縮成了40分鐘。

blocks.def: unsuccessful or showing no activity or development
blocks.trans: 不順利的；停滯的，沒有進展的
examples:
Her career was in the doldrums during those years.
那些年她的事業一直沒有什麼起色。

blocks.def: sad and with no energy or enthusiasm
blocks.trans: 心灰意冷的；無精打采的

blocks.def: an area of sea where ships are unable to move because there is no wind
to make something seem less important or less bad than it really is
examples:
The government has been trying to downplay the crisis.
政府一直在盡力淡化此次危機的嚴重性。

blocks.def: When the sea or tide ebbs, it moves away from the coast and falls to a lower level.
If a physical or emotional feeling ebbs, it becomes less strong or disappears.
examples:
He could feel his strength ebbing (away).
他能感覺到自己逐漸體力不支。

blocks.def: the tide when it is moving away from the coast
examples:
We'll sail on the ebb.
我們將在退潮時啟航。

blocks.def: very energetic, positive, and happy
blocks.trans: 精力充沛的；熱情洋溢的；興高采烈的
examples:
He wasn't his usual ebullient self.
一向熱情洋溢的他一反常態，好像換了個人似的。

blocks.def: to improve someone's mind
a sad poem or song, especially remembering someone who has died or something in the past
blocks.trans: （尤指懷念故人或往事的）輓歌；輓詩；哀歌
examples:
Gray's "Elegy in a Country Churchyard" is a famous English poem.
格雷的《墓園輓歌》是一首著名的英國詩。

blocks.def: to represent a quality or an idea exactly
examples:
She embodied good sportsmanship on the playing field.
在運動場上，她展現了優秀的體育精神。

blocks.def: to include as part of something
examples:
Kennett embodied in one man an unusual range of science, music, and religion.
肯尼特集科學、音樂、宗教等方面一系列非凡成就於一身。

blocks.def: the belief in using empirical methods
a piece of writing, speech, etc. that praises someone or something
to make someone or something very weak
to make something necessary, or to involve something
examples:
Such a large investment inevitably entails some risk.
這樣的钜額投資必然會有一定的風險。
 [ + -ing verb ] Repairing the roof will entail spending a lot of money.
修屋頂免不了要花好多錢。

blocks.def: to persuade someone to do something by offering them something pleasant
examples:
The adverts entice the customer into buying things they don't really want.
廣告誘使顧客購買他們並不真正需要的東西。
 People are being enticed away from the profession by higher salaries elsewhere.
別處更加豐厚的薪水誘使人們辭職另謀高就。
 [ + to infinitive ] A smell of coffee in the doorway enticed people to enter the shop.
門口飄出的咖啡香味使得人們聞香駐足，進入店內。

blocks.def: to avoid something intentionally, or to give something up
examples:
We won't have discussions with this group unless they eschew violence.
除非這個團體放棄使用暴力，否則我們不會與之舉行會談。

blocks.def: very unusual and understood or liked by only a small number of people, especially those with special knowledge
blocks.trans: 極不尋常的；只有少數人（尤指內行）才懂的；限於小圈子的
examples:
He has an esoteric collection of old toys and games.
他收藏了一批極罕見的老玩具和遊戲。
disapproving or humorous She has a somewhat esoteric taste in clothes.
她的衣著品味極不尋常。

blocks.def: to become involved with or support an activity or opinion
blocks.trans: 投身（活動）；支持，擁護（觀點）
examples:
Vegetarianism is one cause she does not espouse.
她並不贊成素食主義。

blocks.def: to cause someone to no longer have a friendly relationship with another person or other people
examples:
Her lifestyle estranged her from her parents.
她的生活方式使她跟父母越來越疏遠。

blocks.def: to cause you to feel that you do not understand someone or something, or do not have any connection with him, her, or it
examples:
Cultural changes can estrange the reader from old texts.
文化演變可能導致讀者難以理解舊時作品的內容。

blocks.def: to be or give a typical example of something
blocks.trans: 作為…的典範（或範例、典型、榜樣等）；舉例說明
examples:
This painting perfectly exemplifies the naturalistic style which was so popular at the time.
這幅油畫是那個時期風靡一時的自然主義風格的完美典範。

blocks.def: very small in size or amount
examples:
I got a teaching job at an exiguous rate of pay.
我得到了一份工資微薄的教書工作。

blocks.def: to remove or destroy something completely
to praise something or someone very much
examples:
His book extolling the benefits of vegetarianism sold thousands of copies.
他那本宣揚素食益處的書賣出了好幾千本。
 She is forever extolling the virtues of her children.
她經常誇耀自己小孩的優點。

blocks.def: not directly connected with or related to something
examples:
extraneous information
無關訊息
 These questions are extraneous to the issue being discussed.
這些問題和正在討論的議題無關。

blocks.def: (especially of people and their behaviour) very energetic
blocks.trans: （尤指人或其行為）精力充沛的，熱情洋溢的，興高采烈的
examples:
Young and exuberant, he symbolizes Italy's new vitality.
青春年少、意氣風發，他代表了義大利朝氣勃勃的生力軍。

blocks.def: (of plants) strong and growing quickly
If you exude love, confidence, pain, etc., you show that you have a lot of that feeling.
blocks.trans: 明顯地流露，充分顯露（愛、自信、痛苦等）
examples:
She just exudes confidence.
她顯得信心十足。

blocks.def: to produce a smell or liquid substance from inside
examples:
Some trees exude from their bark a sap that repels insect parasites.
一些樹的樹皮會分泌出一種汁液來驅除寄生在樹上的昆蟲。

blocks.def: giving too much attention to small details and wanting everything to be correct and perfect
blocks.trans: 一絲不苟的；過分嚴謹的；苛求的
examples:
He is very fastidious about how a suitcase should be packed.
他對如何收拾行裝要求很嚴格。

blocks.def: having a strong dislike of anything dirty or unpleasant
examples:
They were too fastidious to eat in a fast-food restaurant.
他們太講究了，不會在速食店吃飯。

blocks.def: a unit for measuring the depth of water, equal to 1.8 metres or 6 feet
blocks.trans: 英尋（測量水深單位，合1.8米或6英尺）

blocks.def: to discover the meaning of something
examples:
For years people have been trying to fathom (out) the mysteries of the whale's song.
多年來人們一直試圖弄清鯨魚歌聲之謎。

blocks.def: to understand someone or why someone acts as they do
examples:
I can't fathom her at all.
我一點也搞不懂她。

blocks.def: to pretend to have a particular feeling, problem, etc.
examples:
You know how everyone feigns surprise when you tell them how old you are.
你知道當你告訴別人你的年齡時，他們如何故作驚訝。
 The prosecution claimed that the defendant had feigned the injury.
原告代理律師稱被告的傷是偽裝的。
 She responded to his remarks with feigned amusement.
她假裝對他的話感興趣。

blocks.def: the state of being frightening and violent
examples:
The ferocity of the attack shocked a lot of people.
襲擊的凶猛程度震驚了很多人。
 The hurricane hit with terrible ferocity.
飓風以可怕的烈度襲來。

blocks.def: likely to change your opinion or your feelings suddenly and without a good reason
blocks.trans: （意見或感情）反覆無常的，易變的
examples:
She's so fickle - she's never been interested in the same man for more than a week!
她是如此變幻無常，從未喜歡過一個男人超過一星期。
 The world of popular music is notoriously fickle.
流行音樂界的變幻無常是出了名的。

blocks.def: Fickle conditions are likely to change suddenly and without warning.
examples:
Fickle winds made sailing conditions difficult.
風向不定增加了航海的難度。

blocks.def: made of or covered in flagstones
examples:
a flagged path
石板路

blocks.def: to show or make obvious something you are proud of in order to get admiration
examples:
He's got a lot of money but he doesn't flaunt it.
他有很多錢，但從不炫耀。
 Flavio was flaunting his tan in a pair of white trunks.
弗拉維奧穿了一條白色的游泳褲，炫耀自己曬成棕褐色的肌膚。

blocks.def: to show your body in a confident and sexual manner
short or quick
examples:
a fleeting glimpse
迅速的一瞥
 This is just a fleeting visit.
這只是一次短暫的訪問。

blocks.def: not serious about a serious subject, in an attempt to be funny or to appear clever
examples:
a flippant remark/attitude
輕率的言論／態度
 It's easy to be flippant, but we have a serious problem to deal with here.
油嘴滑舌容易，但我們有正經問題要解決。
 I think she just thought I was being flippant.
我想她只是認為我態度輕率。

blocks.def: to intentionally not obey a rule, law, or custom
blocks.trans: 公然藐視，無視，違背（規定、法律或習俗）
examples:
Many motorcyclists flout the law by not wearing helmets.
許多騎機車的人無視法律，不戴頭盔。
 The orchestra decided to flout convention/tradition, and wear their everyday clothes for the concert.
管弦樂隊決定一改傳統，在音樂會上穿日常服裝。

blocks.def: to change, especially continuously and between one level or thing and another
examples:
Vegetable prices fluctuate according to the season.
蔬菜價格隨著季節變化而漲落。
 Her wages fluctuate between £150 and £200 a week.
她的週薪在150英鎊到200英鎊之間浮動。
 Her weight fluctuates wildly.
她的體重起伏很大。
 fluctuating prices
波動的價格

blocks.def: praise or other polite speech or behaviour that is not sincere and does not really mean anything
examples:
These letters are full of the most ornate diplomatic flummery.
這些信件充滿了華麗的恭維之詞。

blocks.def: a sweet soft food popular in the past, made with milk or cream, sugar and other ingredients such as oats (= a type of grain), gelatine (= a substance used to make jelly), eggs, or fruit
blocks.trans: 小麥（或燕麥）粥（舊時的一種常見食物）

blocks.def: a very thin sheet of metal, especially used to wrap food in to keep it fresh
blocks.trans: （尤指用來包裹食品以保鮮的）箔
examples:
tin foil
錫箔
UK aluminium foil
鋁箔

blocks.def: something or someone that makes another's good or bad qualities more noticeable
examples:
The older, cynical character in the play is the perfect foil for the innocent William.
劇中年邁、憤世嫉俗的人物角色正好襯托出威廉的天真單純。

blocks.def: a thin, light sword used in the sport of fencing
to prevent someone or something from being successful
examples:
The prisoners' attempt to escape was foiled at the last minute when police received a tip-off.
由於警方收到密報，囚犯的越獄企圖在最後一刻被挫敗。

blocks.def: to go from place to place searching for things that you can eat or use
examples:
The children had been living on the streets, foraging for scraps.
那些孩子露宿街頭，四處尋找殘羹剩飯。
 The pigs foraged in the woods for acorns.
那些豬在樹林裡找橡果吃。
 The chef offers special dishes of wild and foraged foods, including wood pigeon and snails.

blocks.def: food grown for horses and farm animals
examples:
winter forage
冬季飼料
 forage crops
飼料作物

blocks.def: to prevent yourself from saying or doing something, especially in a way that shows control, good judgment, or kindness to others
examples:
His plan was such a success that even his original critics could scarcely forbear from congratulating him.
他的計劃獲得了巨大的成功，甚至那些原先的批評者們也禁不住向他表示祝賀。
 The doctor said she was optimistic about the outcome of the operation but forbore to make any promises at this early stage.
醫生稱她對手術結果持樂觀態度，但在這一早期階段不會做出任何承諾。

blocks.def:
a 
forebear formal
to act as a warning or sign of a future event
examples:
The recent outbreak of violence was foreshadowed by isolated incidents in the city earlier this year.
今年早些時候城裡發生的幾宗孤立事件是近來爆發的暴力事件的預兆。

blocks.def: to not have or do something enjoyable
blocks.trans: 放棄，摒絕（令人愉悅之物）
examples:
I shall have to forgo the pleasure of seeing you this week.
這周我只好放棄與您相見的那份榮幸了。

blocks.def: causing you to have fear or respect for something or someone because that thing or person is large, powerful, or difficult
blocks.trans: 可怕的；令人敬畏的；難對付的
examples:
a formidable obstacle/task
令人生畏的障礙／任務
 a formidable adversary/enemy/opponent
難對付的敵手／勁敵／強大的對手
 a formidable intellect
令人敬畏的知識分子
disapproving the director and his formidable wife
導演和他那令人生畏的妻子

blocks.def: (too) honest or direct in behaviour
blocks.trans: （過於）坦誠的，直率的；直截了當的
examples:
His forthright manner can be mistaken for rudeness.
他率直的態度可能會被誤認為無禮。
 I admire her forthright way of dealing with people.
我欽佩她待人率直。

blocks.def: (of something that is to your advantage) not planned, happening by chance
blocks.trans: （有利的事）偶然發生的，碰巧的
examples:
The timing of the meeting is certainly fortuitous.
這次會議的時機真是太巧了。
 The collapse of its rivals was a fortuitous opportunity for the company.
競爭對手的倒閉給這間公司帶來了意外的機會。

blocks.def: to take care of a child, usually for a limited time, without being the child's legal parent
blocks.trans: 收養，代養，撫育（他人子女，通常指有限的一段時間）
examples:
Would you consider fostering (a child)?
你會考慮代養一個孩子嗎？

blocks.def: to encourage the development or growth of ideas or feelings
examples:
I'm trying to foster an interest in classical music in my children.
我正努力培養我的孩子們對古典音樂的興趣。
 They were discussing the best way to foster democracy and prosperity in the former communist countries.
他們正在討論促進前共産主義國家民主和繁榮的最佳辦法。

blocks.def: used to refer to someone or something connected with the care of children, usually for a limited time, by someone who is not the child's legal parent
blocks.trans: （在有限的一段時間內）（所）收養的，（所）代養的
examples:
a foster care/home/child/mother
非親代養／寄養家庭／代養的孩子／養母
 The neglected child was removed from her home and placed with a foster family.
這名未受妥善照顧的女孩子被送到了一戶寄養家庭中。
 As a child, he had lived with a series of foster parents.
他小時候和好幾任養父母一起生活過。
 her foster father/mother

blocks.def: full of unpleasant things such as problems or dangers
blocks.trans: 充滿（問題、危險等令人不快之物）的
examples:
The negotiations have been fraught with difficulties/problems right from the start.
談判從一開始就困難／問題重重。
 From beginning to end, the airlift was fraught with risks.
那次空運自始至終都危機四伏。

blocks.def: causing or having extreme worry or anxiety
blocks.trans: 令人極度憂慮的，十分擔心的
examples:
This is one of the most fraught weekends of the year for the security forces.
這是一年中最令安全部隊緊張不安的週末之一。
 The atmosphere in the office is rather fraught.
辦公室裡彌漫著一種極度緊張焦慮的氣氛。

blocks.def: careful when using money or food, or (of a meal) cheap or small in amount
blocks.trans: 節儉的；樸素的；（食物）簡單的，廉價的
examples:
a frugal lifestyle
節儉的生活方式
 a frugal meal of bread and soup
只有麵包和湯的便宜飯食

blocks.def: (of people) behaving secretly and often dishonestly, or (of actions) done secretly and often dishonestly
blocks.trans: （人）偷偷摸摸的；鬼鬼祟祟的；（行動）秘密的
examples:
I saw him cast a furtive glance at the woman at the table to his right.
我看到他偷偷地掃了一眼坐在他右邊桌子旁的女人。
 He made one or two furtive phone calls.
他鬼鬼祟祟地打了一兩個電話。
 There was something furtive about his behaviour and I immediately felt suspicious.
他鬼鬼祟祟的，我馬上覺得有些可疑。

blocks.def: (of actions) having no effect or achieving nothing
blocks.trans: （行動）無作用的；無效的；不成功的
examples:
Attempts to get supplies to the region are futile because troops will not allow the aid convoy to enter the city.
往該地區運送物資的努力失敗了，因爲軍方不允許救援物資護送隊進城。
 It's completely futile trying to reason with him - he just won't listen.
跟他講道理一點用都沒有——他就是不聽。
 All my attempts to cheer her up proved futile.
我想讓她快活起來，但所有的努力都白費了。

blocks.def: to refuse to accept something as the truth
examples:
Certainly there's no gainsaying (= it is not possible to doubt) the technical brilliance of his performance.
無可否認，他的演奏技巧非常精湛。

blocks.def: to cause someone to suddenly take action, especially by shocking or exciting them in some way
examples:
Western charities were galvanized by TV pictures of starving people.
饑民的照片在電視上播出後，西方的慈善組織倍感震驚，馬上行動了起來。
 The prospect of his mother coming to stay galvanized him into action and he started cleaning the house.
他母親要來和他一起住了，這才使得他打起精神，開始清掃房屋。

blocks.def: having the habit of talking a lot, especially about things that are not important
blocks.trans: （尤指對雞毛蒜皮的事情）喋喋不休的，絮叨的，饒舌的

blocks.def: to calculate an amount, especially by using a measuring device
blocks.trans: （尤指用測量儀器）測量，計量，測算
examples:
Use a thermometer to gauge the temperature.
用溫度計測量一下溫度。
 I tried to gauge (= guess) the weight of the box.
我試著估量箱子有多重。

blocks.def: to make a judgment about something, usually people's feelings
blocks.trans: 判定，判斷（通常指人的感受）
examples:
A poll was conducted to gauge consumers' attitudes.
為了摸清消費者的看法，進行了一次民意調查。
 [ + question word ] It's difficult to gauge how they'll react.
很難判斷他們會作何反應。

blocks.def: a device for measuring the amount or size of something
examples:
a fuel/rain/temperature gauge
燃料表／雨量計／溫度計

blocks.def: a device used to measure the pressure of the air in a tyre
examples:
a tyre gauge
胎壓計

blocks.def: the distance between the rails (= the two long metal bars attached to the ground) on a railway line
examples:
a narrow-gauge/standard-gauge railway
窄軌距／標準軌距鐵軌

blocks.def: the thickness of something, especially metal or wire
blocks.trans: （尤指金屬板的）厚度；（尤指金屬絲的）直徑

blocks.def: the space inside a pipe or tube, or the diameter of (= measurement across) this space
examples:
a narrow gauge
窄口徑
 a gauge of 16 millimetres
16毫米的口徑

blocks.def: a way of judging or showing something, especially how successful or popular something is
blocks.trans: （尤指對是否成功或受歡迎的）評判方法，判斷方法
examples:
The fact that the play is being performed on Broadway is a gauge of its success.
該劇在百老匯演出，從這一點就可以判定它是很成功的。

blocks.def: used in adjectives to express the width of the space inside a cylinder, especially the inside of a gun barrel (= part shaped like a tube)
examples:
a twelve-gauge shotgun
口徑為12毫米的獵槍

blocks.def: to collect information in small amounts and often with difficulty
examples:
From what I was able to glean, the news isn't good.
從我辛苦收集到的資訊來看，情況不妙。
 They're leaving on Tuesday - I managed to glean that much (from them).
他們將在星期二離開——我辛辛苦苦（從他們那裡）打探到的就只有這些。

blocks.def: a supply of something that is much greater than can be sold or is needed or wanted
examples:
The fall in demand for coffee could cause a glut on/in the market.
咖啡需求減少會導致市場供應過盛。
 The current glut of graduates means that many of them will not be able to find jobs.
現在大學畢業生人數過多，意味著他們當中許多人無法找到工作。

blocks.def: a strong complaint
examples:
Her main gripe is that she's not being trained properly.
她主要是抱怨自己沒有受到很好的訓練。

blocks.def: A hackneyed phrase or idea has been said or used so often that it has become boring and has no meaning.
examples:
The plot of the film is just a hackneyed boy-meets-girl scenario.
這部電影的情節只不過是一個俗套的愛情故事。

blocks.def: to prevent someone doing something easily
examples:
Fierce storms have been hampering rescue efforts and there is now little chance of finding more survivors.
猛烈的暴風雨妨礙了救援工作的進行，現在找到更多生還者的希望已經很渺茫了。

blocks.def: a large, rectangular container with a lid
examples:
a picnic hamper
野餐盒

blocks.def: a box containing food and drink, usually given as a present, for example at Christmas
blocks.trans: （通常作爲禮品、裝有食品和酒的）食品盒

blocks.def: a container used for carrying dirty clothes and bed sheets and for storing them while they are waiting to be washed
to speak to someone or a group of people, often for a long time, in a forceful and sometimes angry way, especially to persuade them
examples:
A drunk in the station was haranguing passers-by.
一名醉漢在車站大聲訓斥路人。

blocks.def: unfriendly and seeming to consider yourself better than other people
examples:
She has a rather haughty manner.
她的舉止非常傲慢。

blocks.def: to cause repeated suffering or anxiety
examples:
Fighting in Vietnam was an experience that would haunt him for the rest of his life.
越南戰爭的經歷給他日後的生活留下了揮之不去的陰影。
 30 years after the fire he is still haunted by images of death and destruction.
那場火災過去30年之後，死亡和毀滅的場景仍在他腦海中揮之不去。

blocks.def: (of a ghost) to appear in a place repeatedly
examples:
A ghostly lady is said to haunt the stairway looking for her children.
據說有一個像幽靈似的女人經常出現在樓梯上尋找她的孩子。

blocks.def: a place often visited
examples:
This bar used to be one of your old haunts, didn't it, Jake?
這個酒吧你以前經常去，對不對，傑克？

blocks.def: a formal and unfriendly way of behaving that suggests that the person thinks they are better than other people
blocks.trans: 倨傲，傲慢態度，神氣活現的樣子

blocks.def: full of activity, or very busy and fast
examples:
a hectic schedule
滿滿的行程表
 The area has become a haven for people tired of the hectic pace of city life.
這一地區成了那些厭倦城市繁忙生活的人們的安樂窩。

blocks.def: the most successful or popular period of someone or something
examples:
In their heyday, they sold as many records as all the other groups in the country put together.
在他們的全盛時期，他們唱片的銷售量是這個國家中所有其他樂隊唱片銷量的總和。

blocks.def: very emotional and energetic, but not sincere or without real meaning
examples:
a histrionic outburst
裝腔作勢的情感爆發
 She put on a histrionic display of grief at the funeral.
她在葬禮上裝出一副悲傷的樣子。

blocks.def: until now or until a particular time
examples:
Mira revealed hitherto unsuspected talents on the dance floor.
時至今日，米拉已經顯示出在舞蹈方面潛藏的非凡才能。

blocks.def: a confused mixture of different things
examples:
New Age thinking seems to be a hodgepodge of old and new ideas.
新時代思想似乎就是新舊思想的大雜燴。

blocks.def: to make an object sharp
examples:
The bone had been honed to a point.
那塊骨頭已經被磨尖了。

blocks.def: to make something perfect or completely suitable for its purpose
examples:
His physique was honed to perfection.
他的身材鍛鍊得很完美。
 Her debating skills were honed in the students' union.
她的辯論技巧是在學生會裡磨練出來的。

blocks.def: showing or giving honour or respect
examples:
an honorific title
尊稱

blocks.def: a way of talking or behaving that is too proud
examples:
He was punished for his hubris.
他因為自大而受到懲罰。

blocks.def: an idea that is based on feeling and for which there is no proof
examples:
[ + that ] I had a hunch that you'd be here.
直覺告訴我，你會來。
 Sometimes you have to be prepared to act on/follow a hunch.
有時候你要有心理準備依直覺行事。

blocks.def: to lean forward with your shoulders raised or to bend your back and shoulders into a rounded shape
examples:
We hunched round the fire to keep warm.
我們弓著身子圍在火邊取暖。
 Stand up straight and don't hunch your back.
站直，別彎著腰。

blocks.def: to fill something or someone with a particular feeling, quality, or idea
examples:
His poetry is imbued with deep, religious feeling.
他的詩歌充滿了深厚的宗教情感。

blocks.def: impossible to see through or go through
blocks.trans: 不能看透的；不能穿過的
examples:
Outside, the fog was thick and impenetrable.
外面的霧很濃，甚麼也看不見。
 an impenetrable barrier
無法跨越的障礙

blocks.def: impossible to understand
examples:
Some of the lyrics on their latest album are completely impenetrable.
他們最新專輯中的一些歌詞讓人完全看不懂。

blocks.def: to put something or someone at risk or in danger of being harmed or destroyed
examples:
A police raid would imperil the lives of the hostages.
警方的突襲會危及人質的生命安全。

blocks.def: done or said without earlier planning or preparation
examples:
an impromptu party/performance
臨時晚會／即興表演

blocks.def: only recently or partly formed, or not completely developed or clear
blocks.trans: 才開始的；不完全的；未發展完善的
examples:
She had a child's inchoate awareness of language.
她具有兒童對語言的初步意識。

blocks.def: not thinking about or interested in someone or something
blocks.trans: 不感興趣的；不關心的，冷淡的
examples:
Why don't you vote - how can you be so indifferent (to what is going on)?
你為甚麼不投票？你怎能（對正在發生的事情）如此漠不關心！
 He found it very hard teaching a class full of indifferent teenagers.
他發覺教一班無動於衷的十幾歲的孩子真是頭痛。

blocks.def: not good, but not very bad
examples:
We didn't like the restaurant much - the food was indifferent and the service rather slow.
我們不怎麼喜歡這家餐館——飯菜一般，上菜也相當慢。

blocks.def: very poor
blocks.trans: 十分貧困的，十分貧窮的

blocks.def: allowing someone to have or do what they want, especially when this is not good for them
examples:
indulgent relatives
待人寬厚的親戚
 an indulgent smile
寬容的微笑
 He had been a strict father but was indulgent to/towards his grandchildren.
他曾是個嚴厲的父親，但對孫子孫女卻很嬌慣。

blocks.def: An industrious person works hard.
examples:
an industrious worker
勤勞的工人
 She's extremely competent and industrious.
她非常勤奮、能幹。

blocks.def: not confident enough to say or do what you want
examples:
The presence of strangers made her feel inhibited.
陌生人在場使她感到拘謹。

blocks.def: wanting to discover as much as you can about things, sometimes in a way that annoys people
blocks.trans: 好問的；愛鑽研的；好打聽的
examples:
an inquisitive child
好奇愛問的小孩
 an inquisitive mind
愛鑽研的人
 She could see inquisitive faces looking out from the windows next door.
她可以看到一張張好奇的面孔從隔壁房子的窗戶向外探望。

blocks.def: (of speech and writing) clear enough to be understood
examples:
She was so upset when she spoke that she was hardly intelligible.
她講話時心煩意亂，結果她的話幾乎讓人無法理解。

blocks.def: the effect that two or more things have on each other
examples:
Our personalities result from the complex interplay between our genes and our environment.
我們的個性是基因與環境之間複雜的相互影響的結果。

blocks.def: being an extremely important and basic characteristic of a person or thing
examples:
works of little intrinsic value/interest
本身無甚價值／趣味的作品
 Maths is an intrinsic part of the school curriculum.
數學是中小學的基礎課。

blocks.def: If you become inured to something unpleasant, you become familiar with it and able to accept and bear it.
blocks.trans: 使（某人）習慣於（令人不快的事物）
examples:
After spending some time on the island they became inured to the hardships.
在島上留了一段時間後，他們適應了那裡的艱苦生活。

blocks.def: criticism that is very forceful, unkind, and often rude
examples:
A stream of invective from some sectors of the press continues to assail the government.
某些新聞機構繼續對政府口誅筆伐。

blocks.def: to persuade someone to do something in a clever and dishonest way, when they do not want to do it
examples:
Her son tried to inveigle her into giving him the money for a car.
她兒子想方設法哄她給錢買汽車。

blocks.def: very simple or childish
blocks.trans: 簡單的；幼稚的，不成熟的
examples:
He made jejune generalizations about how all students were lazy and never did any work.
他以偏概全地認為所有的學生都很懶惰，甚麼都不做。

blocks.def: boring and not interesting
examples:
a jejune lecture by one of our professors
我們的教授之一講的一堂乏味的課

blocks.def: to put something such as a plan or system in danger of being harmed or damaged
blocks.trans: 使處於危險境地；危及，損害
examples:
She knew that by failing her finals she could jeopardize her whole future.
她知道考試不及格會影響自己整個未來的前途。

blocks.def: to get rid of something or someone that is not wanted or needed
examples:
The station has jettisoned educational broadcasts.
電台已取消了教育廣播。

blocks.def: to decide not to use an idea or plan
examples:
We've had to jettison our trip because of David's accident.
因為大衛發生了意外事故我們不得不放棄度假計劃。

blocks.def: to throw goods, fuel, or equipment from a ship or aircraft to make it lighter
blocks.trans: （船舶、飛機等為減輕重量而）投棄（貨物、燃料或裝備）
examples:
The captain was forced to jettison the cargo and make an emergency landing.
機長被迫投棄機上的貨物並緊急降落。

blocks.def: (of a problem or difficulty) complicated and difficult to solve
blocks.trans: 錯綜複雜的；難於解決的，棘手的
examples:
It was a very knotty problem.
那實在是一個棘手的問題。

blocks.def: with a lot of knots
examples:
a knotty piece of wood
多節的木頭

blocks.def: to express sadness and feeling sorry about something
blocks.trans: 對…感到悲痛，對…表示失望，痛惜
examples:
The poem opens by lamenting (over) the death of a young man.
這首詩的開篇表達了對一位青年之死的惋惜之情。
 My grandmother, as usual, lamented the decline in moral standards in today's society.
和往常一樣，我奶奶對當今社會世風日下深感痛惜。
 The late lamented (= dead and remembered with love) Frank Giotto used to live here.
已故的受人愛戴的法蘭克‧焦托曾在此居住。

blocks.def: a song, poem, or other piece of writing that expresses sadness about someone's death
examples:
The whole play can be interpreted as a lament for lost youth.
整部劇可以看作是一首青春的輓歌。

blocks.def: to exist in an unpleasant or unwanted situation, often for a long time
examples:
After languishing in obscurity for many years, her early novels have recently been rediscovered.
她的早期小說在沈寂多年後最近被重新發掘出來。
 He has been languishing in jail for the past 20 years.
過去的20年中他一直在監獄裡苦熬。
 The ruling party is languishing in third place in the opinion polls.
執政黨在民意調查中處於第三的尷尬位置。

blocks.def: present but needing particular conditions to become active, obvious, or completely developed
examples:
Recent developments in the area have brought latent ethnic tension out into the open.
近來該地區的一些新情況導致民族之間潛在的緊張關係公開化了。
 We're trying to bring out the latent artistic talents that many people possess without realizing it.
我們正在努力挖掘許多人自身具有但卻沒有意識到的潛在藝術才能。

blocks.def: large in quantity and expensive or impressive
examples:
lavish gifts/promises/praise
奢華的禮物／慷慨的允諾／毫不吝惜的讚揚
 lavish spending
鋪張的開支
 lavish banquets
豪華的宴會
 The evening was a lavish affair with glorious food and an endless supply of champagne.
晚會很豪華，食物精美可口，香檳源源不斷。
 The lavish production makes this musical truly memorable.
這部音樂劇的豪華製作陣容給人留下了深刻印象。

blocks.def: very generous
examples:
The critics were lavish in their praise for the paintings.
藝術評論人對這幅油畫大加讚賞。

blocks.def: without much care, attention, or control
examples:
The subcommittee contends that the authorities were lax in investigating most of the cases.
小組委員會認為有關部門對多宗案件疏於調查。

blocks.def: not severe or strong enough
examples:
He took a gun through baggage control to highlight the lax security.
他攜帶一把槍通過了行李檢查，以此引起大家對安全管理鬆懈這一問題的重視。

blocks.def: (of a speech sound) made without much force
to arrange something on a flat surface
examples:
Most of Manhattan is laid out in/on a grid pattern.
在曼哈頓的大部分地區呈網格狀排列。
 We laid the pieces of the dress pattern out on the floor.
我們把衣服樣品一件一件都攤開在地板上。

blocks.def: to spend money, especially a large amount
examples:
It's not every day you lay out $500 on a dress.
花500美元買條長裙可不是常有的事。

blocks.def: to explain something clearly, usually in writing
blocks.trans: （通常用書寫的方式）向…清楚地解釋
examples:
The code of practice lays out very clearly what the duties of the registrar are.
行為規範清楚寫明瞭註冊員的責任。

blocks.def: someone who is part of a religious organization but who is not paid or specially trained
someone who is not trained in or does not have a detailed knowledge of a particular subject
having little energy; feeling unwilling and unable to do anything
blocks.trans: 萎靡不振的，無精打采的；懶散的，倦怠的
examples:
I was feeling tired and lethargic.
我覺得渾身乏力、無精打采。

blocks.def: clear and transparent
examples:
a limpid pool
清澈的池塘

blocks.def: clearly expressed and easily understood
blocks.trans: 表述清楚的，明白易懂的
examples:
limpid prose
明白易懂的散文

blocks.def: a record of short pieces of information, such as people's names, usually written or printed with a single thing on each line and often ordered in a way that makes a particular thing easy to find
examples:
a shopping list
購物單
 Is your name on the list?
名單上有你的名字嗎？
 I've made a list of places I'd like to visit while we're in Paris.
我把我們在巴黎期間我想去的地方列了一個單子。

blocks.def: If a ship has a list, it leans to one side.
to make a list, or to include something in a list
blocks.trans: 將…列成單子；把…列入名單
examples:
I've listed some useful reading material on the handout.
我在發給大家的講義上列出了一些有用的閱讀材料。

blocks.def: (of a ship) to lean to one side, especially as a result of damage
blocks.trans: （尤指船因遭到損害向一側）傾斜，歪斜
examples:
The tanker is listing badly and liable to sink at any moment.
油輪嚴重傾斜，隨時都可能會沈沒。

blocks.def: to make a company's shares available on a particular financial market
examples:
Last year, eight new companies were listed on the Lahore stock exchange.
去年有8家公司在拉合爾股票交易所上市。

blocks.def: to hate someone or something
examples:
From an early age the brothers have loathed each other.
自小時候起，兄弟倆就一直相互厭惡。
 "Do you like fish?" "No, I loathe it."
「你喜歡魚嗎？」「不，我討厭魚。」
 [ + -ing verb ] I loathe doing housework.
我討厭做家務。

blocks.def: with one side bigger, higher, etc. than the other; not equally balanced
blocks.trans: 不平衡的，向一側傾斜的
examples:
a charming, lopsided grin
迷人的撇嘴一笑

blocks.def: sad and serious
examples:
a lugubrious face
愁眉苦臉的樣子

blocks.def: to cause someone to feel calm or to feel that they want to sleep
examples:
The motion of the car almost lulled her to sleep.
汽車的顛簸讓她昏昏欲睡。

blocks.def: a short period of calm in which little happens
examples:
There has been a lull in the fighting.
戰鬥中出現了一段間歇。
 a lull in the conversation/traffic
談話的間歇／交通低谷

blocks.def: to pretend to be ill in order to avoid having to work
examples:
And is he really ill or just malingering?
他是真的病了還是在裝病？

blocks.def: A malleable substance is easily changed into a new shape.
examples:
Lead and tin are malleable metals.
鉛和錫都是具延展性的金屬。

blocks.def: easily influenced, trained, or controlled
blocks.trans: 易受外界影響的；可塑的；易被控制的
examples:
He had an actor's typically malleable features.
他具有演員典型的可塑性強的特徵。
 Europe saw its colonies as a source of raw material and a malleable workforce.
歐洲曾把其殖民地看作是原料和馴服勞動力的來源地。

blocks.def: showing emotion or love in an awkward or silly way
blocks.trans: 無病呻吟的；多愁善感的
examples:
The film lapses into mawkish sentimentality near the end.
電影到結局部分成了令人生厭的濫情戲。

blocks.def: (of amounts or numbers) very small or not enough
examples:
a meagre salary
微薄的薪水
 The prisoners existed on a meagre diet.
那些囚犯靠少得可憐的食物維持生存。

blocks.def: changing suddenly and often
examples:
a mercurial temperament
易變的性情
 She was entertaining but unpredictable, with mercurial mood swings.
她很會逗人開心，但性格讓人捉摸不透，情緒反覆無常。

blocks.def: intelligent, enthusiastic, and quick
examples:
a mercurial mind/wit
活躍的思維／機敏的才智

blocks.def: containing or caused by mercury
examples:
mercurial drugs
含汞的藥物

blocks.def: seeming attractive but really false or of little value
blocks.trans: 華而不實的，金玉其外的
examples:
He claims that a lot of journalism is meretricious and superficial.
他稱許多新聞報道虛誇膚淺。

blocks.def: very careful and with great attention to every detail
blocks.trans: 嚴謹的，一絲不苟的；非常注意細節的
examples:
Many hours of meticulous preparation have gone into writing the book.
為寫此書，投入了大量時間細心做前期準備。

blocks.def: a small amount of something good such as truth or honesty
examples:
There's not even a modicum of truth in her statement.
她的話裡半句真話都沒有。
 Anyone with a modicum of common sense could have seen that the plan wouldn't work.
稍有常識的人都會發現這個計劃不可行。

blocks.def: lasting for a very short time
examples:
a momentary hesitation
片刻的猶豫

blocks.def: very important because of effects on future events
examples:
the momentous news of the president's death
總統去世的重大消息
 Whether or not to move overseas was a momentous decision for the family.
是否移居海外對這個家庭來說是個重要的決定。

blocks.def: very ordinary and therefore not interesting
examples:
Mundane matters such as paying bills and shopping for food do not interest her.
她對付帳單、購買食物等瑣事不感興趣。

blocks.def: the worst moment, or the moment of least hope and least achievement
blocks.trans: 最糟糕的時刻；最消沉的時刻；最失意的時候；最低點
examples:
The defeat was the nadir of her career.
那次挫敗是她職業生涯的谷底。

blocks.def: someone who says something is not possible, is not good, or will fail
examples: He ignored the naysayers and persevered.

blocks.def: (especially of ideas) not clear and having no form
blocks.trans: （尤指想法）模糊不清的，含糊的
examples:
She has a few nebulous ideas about what she might want to do in the future, but nothing definite.
她對自己將來要做甚麼有些模糊的想法，但都不確定。

blocks.def: the act of using your power or influence to get good jobs or unfair advantages for members of your own family
examples:
He was guilty of nepotism and corruption.
他任人唯親且貪汙腐化。

blocks.def: a very slight difference in appearance, meaning, sound, etc.
blocks.trans: （外表、意義、聲音等的）細微差別
examples:
The painter has managed to capture every nuance of the woman's expression.
畫家對這個女子面部表情的刻畫細緻入微。
 Linguists explore the nuances of language.
語言學家研究語言的細微差別。

blocks.def: having a deep spiritual (= religious) quality or connection
examples:
the numinous mysteries of Mozart, Schumann, and Mahler
莫札特、舒曼和馬勒直擊靈魂的神秘

blocks.def: the fact of obeying or respecting someone, or something you do that expresses this
examples:
One by one the noblemen made their obeisances (= bent at the waist) to the queen.
貴族們一一向女王鞠躬行禮。

blocks.def: having a sloping direction, angle, or position
examples:
Through the window came the last few oblique rays of evening sunshine.
最後幾束餘暉透過窗口斜射進來。
 He gave her an oblique glance.
他斜了她一眼。

blocks.def: (of an angle) either more or less than 90°
Oblique remarks are not direct, so that the real meaning is not immediately clear.
blocks.trans: 間接的；拐彎抹角的，不直截了當的
examples:
She made several oblique references to the current financial situation.
她好幾次拐彎抹角地提及目前的財務狀況。

blocks.def:
a 
slash
examples:
Fractions can be written with an oblique, for example 2/3.
分數可以寫成帶斜線的形式，如2/3。

blocks.def: one of the muscles that lies in a sloping direction from the middle of the body
examples:
Strong obliques (side abdominal muscles) support the lower back and help prevent back pain.
強壯的斜肌（腹側肌肉）可支持背部下方，幫助防止背痛。

blocks.def: not conscious of something, especially what is happening around you
blocks.trans: （尤指對周圍發生的事情）毫不在意的，毫無知覺的，未察覺的
examples:
